Posts.Content: Hi has anyone had a port put in ? I want to know know if you need the sedation ? As I need to be able to drive an attend nativity s etc
Posts.Title: Ports

Posts.Content: Thank you very helpful
Posts.Title: Ports

Posts.Content: Hi , yes very normal . Put leaflets in the loo and read as and when ! Try only to think about the next appointment ,the whole picture is too much to deal with . Wish you well soon x
Posts.Title: New to group

Posts.Content: I think your being very normal ,I had my TAX first and FEC last but I still didn't want the last one and tried to get out of it ,I think there comes a point where you run out of fight and want to run for cover . BUT the knowledge i was not giving myself all i could to get well and survive, got me through the door. 8 days that's all till you will feel better again ,you really can do it ,don't be hard on your self , who would want to go through all this ..... Come on be a survivor too xxx
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Hi ,I am having Docetaxel first and did on Christmas Eve , (500mls) Day 1 heavy legs and arms ,complete ' shut down' and in bed but no sickness ,forgot how many kids I had ! Day 2 ' shut downs ' on and off all day . Day 3 less 'shut downs' Day 4 up most of day ,slept on sofa . Day 5 I have a brain ! Been up all day day and hubby drove me to fav cafe ,where because of a thick horrible covering to my tongue I am favouring Icecream milkshakes ,,, !! Days 1, 2 and 3 were scary , I just couldn't move from the bed but lesson learnt don't try to ,give in lay there and then day 4 and 5 arrive and I know I can do this after all , apart from no taste and sore tongue totally liveable with with Ice cream , I am going to get through it . I hope that helps ... Everyone different ..... Symptoms different .....woman are amazing !
Posts.Title: First Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Oh ladies , please, your be ok . It's the drug not you ,you are strong and will be again . I have just had my 3rd Dosetaxal on Tuesday and when going through the early days yes you have dark thoughts and tears ,then as the days go on you awake and think I've done it . I hate every second and worry before the next bout ,BUT KNOW IT WILL BE ALRIGHT , when our heads are back our mouths less sore and bed not a place to lie awake . I send you peace and as this is my first 'back' day , you will get through too . Xx
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Thank you went to practice nurse and she removed them as so sore but the wounds lovely and dry so result !! Thank you all
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy plasters

Posts.Content: Mini milk ice creams, Salt water rinse , Chewing gum , Diflam , Ginger anything , Sticking tongue into dissolved Panodol then gargling and swallowing ! ( worked the best) Only just come through it myself ,wish you well
Posts.Title: sore mouth and throat

Posts.Content: Hi ,I had my lumpectomy on Friday 3/5 , I had a port taken out at the same time and some nodes removed . The problem is .... The plaster under my arm is really hurting as it it attached slightly to my arm and the rest to the armpit and every time I move it pulls and the skin is red and sore and with this heat wave !!! It is all rather uncomfortable . How long did you fine ladies leave your node plasters ? I know the lumpectomy one needs to stay till seen,but can I remove this one ?
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy plasters

Posts.Content: Thank you Wendy ,here too xxx. I am having chemo to shrink mine first ,what is good on these boards you realise that there is not one boob alike nor one treatment fits all , that I find reassuring .xx
Posts.Title: Lump pain

Posts.Content: The only thing I had enjoyed about this whole business is that I am a 'young one ' at 48 that doesn't happen so much and here you are a fine young thing ! I also have grade 3 also having pains in arm pit BUT wanted to tell you my nodes are clear :) I start chemo Xmas eve and have 4 kids hoping that Santa wasn't me after all !!!!! I go for bone scan and port putting in on Wednesday and a heart echo Monday . I really hadn't realised it was all so involved ! I wish you much support for your journey and feel free to keep in touch with the 'oldie !!' Xx
Posts.Title: Lump pain

Posts.Content: Hi,I have a 30mm lump and am awaiting chemo to shrink it before lumpectomy and radio , chemo starts 24/12 My question is .... It has started to hurt ,shooting pain and general ache and discomfort . Is this normal please ?
Posts.Title: Lump pain

Posts.Content: I am sending you a big smile to use when your feeling like you need one !
Posts.Title: Second time around? Results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Think the grinch effect quite normal and more noticeable because we are looking ! But no one else notices this very fine side hair !! Guess when all grows back we will look ' normal' again x
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: I don't know much about it but my blood is being tested for this study , I was BRACA 1/2 neg and genetics (Guys Hos). told me if you were 3 neg BC you MUST have a genetic mutation ,they just don't know what it is yet as the science is too new . I take heart that if its not the main ones the mutation isn't showing up regularly as a recurrence ! So they took blood asked all the medical and family history again and I wait ,but anything that can forward the cancer cure is worth a bit of blood ! So in layman terms ,they pull apart the DNA to extremes to find mutation which can take a while .
Posts.Title: exome sequencing?

Posts.Content: I was told by my breast nurse that it wasn't unusual and a good sign if the lump hurts, mine shrunk quickly during chemo and did hurt on occasions . I am not a DR though so any worries put your mind at rest and seek medical advise .
Posts.Title: Breast lump hardened and sore during fec chemo - is this normal?

Posts.Content: I did mine in reverse so have done 3 Dosetaxal and 1 FEC . It's different but alright ,tired yes ,but not sick . Steroids for 3 days and injections ( very small needle) for 5 days ,better at night time as can make you ache . Was told to have last steroids before 4pm as they can keep you awake. I only had very slight finger pain,for two days at most and not uncomfortable just found opening packets a challenge. My mouth was sore but no more than with FEC. The big difference for me was the way it is given, FEC they put in by hand and T is done by drip and very boring!! By day 5/6 I was back on school run and cycle 2 was much earlier . Have a good meal before hand and drink loads and the fact you will be on no4 makes everything better over half way :)))) Wish you well ladies xx
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: I am going to Guys on Friday for genetic testing due to Triple Neg result . Has anyone been ? What do they do ,was it worth going ? Any advice welcome
Posts.Title: Genetic testing

Posts.Content: I too was worried after being hospitalised with sickness with both pregnancy s and very motion sickness ,even watching on telly ! But I was fine ,sick once but not nauseous and took sickness pills given for first 5 days even though I didn't feel sick and all was well . Hope all goes well for you ,PS found all things ginger very helpful .
Posts.Title: Feeling nervous of my first fec chemo

Posts.Content: Hi love , sorry you find yourself here but you will find helpful advice and support . I would think they will just talk to you and arrange tests later on ,nothing they do is worse than biopsies really. The test are to make sure your care is taylor made for you They will want to find out what type ,where and why your cancer has appeared . Treatments are as varied as the lumps , it doesn't follow that everyone has chemo or mastectomy s . I was totally unaware before this ,what a fantastic science oncology is and how much is available to cure you . Do NOT google you will just scare yourself with too much information and wrong information xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed.

Posts.Content: Hurrah I am normal ! finished FEC 2 weeks ago and legs and knees are painful ,guess its just a side effect then , that's a relief !
Posts.Title: 1st tax and legs ache

Posts.Content: My friend who brought a casserole for 6 over while I was at hospital today. I haven't bought a coffee for weeks ! The bag of DVDs brought round for the kids when I am tired . The fruit cake for the family. A healing stone to put in my bra !!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Just for fun , the lovely things people have done for you ?

Posts.Content: Today I have been told my cancer has 100% gone ,none in nodes and none in the lump ,chemo has got it all . Still have to have radio but I am cancer free . Thank you so much for the advice and support over the last 8 months ,life would of been hard without you all . I wish you well , sue xxxx Ps will be back for radio advice I am sure !!
Posts.Title: Today I am a cancer survivor :)

Posts.Content: I would say take someone with you ,it's hard to take every detail in and good to have someone else to listen . Wish you well soon x
Posts.Title: Had biopsy, see consultant tomorrow

Posts.Content: I am thinking of joining the ARTemis trail along side the chemo that starts soon ,is anyone else taking part ?
Posts.Title: ARTemis trial

Posts.Content: My mouth is sore ho hum My mouth is sore diddle de de And that's enough from me !
Posts.Title: Little ditty

Posts.Content: Brilliant happy for you x
Posts.Title: Done it !!
